title: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x531281]
body:
Hello Guys! We using Geth as a daemon for mining pool, and this crash has happened several times before. The previous one crush is in spoiler below, but it's not entire, because haven't logging configured at the moment. Also we cant find any block more than 11 days with hashrate ~11 Gh/s, but before this it was everythig fine, been finding blocks every 1-2 days. Node is fully in sync and the mining pool is always one block ahead. Dont know if it has any relation to current issue. And one more question. Does exist any way to check hashrate of mining pool directly in Geth? Something like `miner.hashrate` for CPU mining. Thanks a lot in advance for your attention! #### System information Geth version: `Geth Version: 1.9.13-stable Git Commit: cbc4ac264e9671898bff6ec7e434da3eca4bd273 Architecture: amd64 Protocol Versions: [65 64 63] Go Version: go1.14.2 Operating System: linux GOPATH= GOROOT=/build/ethereum-Eeg6__/.go` OS & Version: Ubuntu 1604 LTS #### Steps to reproduce the behaviour sudo geth --datadir=/mnt/sdb/.ethereum --rpc console --cache=12228 --mine --allow-insecure-unlock 2>> geth.log #### Backtrace ```` panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x531281] goroutine 4386075 [running]: math/big.(*Int).Cmp(0x0, 0xc00000e080, 0x9e09a3b97229cc9a) /build/ethereum-Eeg6__/ethereum-1.9.13+build21767+xenial/crypto/crypto.go:240 +0x3b github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/types.recoverPlain(0xc00000eee0, 0xc001a10340, 0xc09c6b9ef0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x20301900000000, 0x7f9dc5b9efff, 0x400, 0x7f9dc5a1d300, 0x418aa2, ...) /build/ethereum-Eeg6__/ethereum-1.9.13+build21767+xenial/core/types/transaction_signing.go:227 +0x106 0xc000050000, 0x7f9e1d432108, 0x0, 0x0) /build/ethereum-Eeg6__/ethereum-1.9.13+build21767+xenial/core/tx_pool.go:804 +0x28e github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.(*TxPool).AddRemotes(0xc00000c3c0, /build/ethereum-Eeg6__/ethereum-1.9.13+build21767+xenial/p2p/peer.go:367 +0x203 Sorry, try again. ````

signal SIGSEGV - guess it's mean some problem with RAM memory?
Is there anything special with your setup?

The first one you reported is _very_ interesting, and I've been trying to repro it (unsuccessfully). regarding the third one (where you only included the first part of the panic), was that the same crash? Do you have a longer stack trace?
can you run a memcheck on this machine?
The last errror `unexpected fault address 0x0` indicates memory problems, so @ligi 's suggestion is a good starting point
We don't have enough information to investigate this further.
